comments:
Build ID: 20061116100

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Setup and configure Duke's Bank J2EE example on JBoss 4.05
2. Create and configure a profile launch configuration for  Duke's bank on JBoss server
3. Ensure the AC is configured correctly and running already.
4. Profiling Duke's bank on Jboss server and choose J2EE Beans Probe type on ARM analysis dialog.
 
      


More information:
when I logon Buke's bank, Eclipse profile monitoring view can't see any EJB related ARM transaction data. Also, I found that the following exception on eclipse console window:

Test environment:
TPTP build 	 	(TPTP-4.4.0 AllInOne-200705080100C)
WTP  	 	(wtp-S-2.0RC0-200705171455)
RTT MA 6.1	(used to capture ARM transaction produced by BtM and push to RTT MS)

Test summarize:
	                    Generic Probe	                    JDBC Probe	               J2EE Beans Probe	                Servlet Probe
         JBoss 4.0.5	PASS	PASS	throw exception  (see Note 1)	PASS
         Websphere 6.0.0.1	PASS	PASS	throw exception   (see Note 1)	PASS
         Weblogic 9.0	PASS	PASS	throw exception   (see Note 1)	PASS


Note 1: 
See the description of defect 190733(https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=190733). 

About the defect 170733(J2EE Beans probe doesn't work when profiling Duke's bank example on JBoss4.05),  I think that BtM's source code has the following two issues:
1.  _entry() method of EJB_probe$Probe_0 class is forgotten to set method name for EJBDataImpl class, which lead to NullPointerException exception to be thrown when processEJBLocalHome() method of EJBDataImpl class call getMethodName().equalsIgnoreCase("remove"). 
2. EJBDataImpl class only handle local EJB type(EJBLocalHome, EJBLocalObject), so if request is come from Remote EJB type(EJBHome,EJBObject), this class will throw ClassCastException exception(try to covert EJBHome to EJBLocalHome). I will investigate on this issue.
Targetting to 4.5 i2. Please add sizing.
